en.value: tradition
Spain is a country with many different traditions.
customs
You have to get used to the different customs when you move to a foreign country.
heritage
The European Heritage Network tends to focus on cultural heritage.
diversity
It is necessary to be aware of the cultural diversity that exists in a country.
multiculturalism
Australia has embraced multiculturalism. There are many people from different cultures living there.
typical cuisine
The typical cuisine of Tuscany is generally very healthy and varied.
native language
The native language of Denmark is Danish but most people speak perfect English.
influence
Religion often has a huge influence on culture.
tower
The Leaning Tower of Pisa.
castle
The castle attracts thousands of tourists a year
library
The British Library is in central London.
monument
The Taj Mahal is one of the world's most famous monuments.
aquarium
You can see lots of sea life in the Sydney aquarium.
museum
The Guggenheim Museum is in Bilbao.
National Park
The USA has many national parks.
market
Lots of cities have interesting street markets.
zoo
San Diego Zoo is committed to animal conservation.
It's tradition!
Talking about traditions and customs
My culture
Memorise the word(s) and listen to the example.
Listen to the dialogue and fill in the gaps.
Olivia! Funny to see you at a Madrid festival! You don't live here anymore, do you? It's great to see you in [k]traditional dress[/k]!
That's right, I'm just here for a holiday and felt like dressing up for the festival! And you told me last year that you were about to move to London, right?
That's right, I'm living there now. I love it, there's so much [k]diversity[/k].
I visited last year, I noticed there were lots of [k]influences[/k] from other cultures.
Yes, they really celebrate [k]multiculturalism[/k].
I hear there are over 50 [k]ethnic groups[/k] living there.
The only thing is, there isn't really a [k]typical cuisine[/k] to rave about.
Let's not believe the [k]stereotypes[/k], the British food is very tasty!
Paul
Olivia
Select the correct option.
Select the words in the correct order.
Fill in the gaps with the correct letters.
What are the things that define a culture?
In my opinion, language defines a large part of the country's culture. Languages are always changing and therefore, for me, it is the most reliable and up-to-date aspect of culture.
Monuments
We need to book our holiday Anna. And we still haven't decided where to go.
I thought we'd decided to go on a bit of a tour. I really want to see some culture and famous [k]monuments[/k] for a change this year.
OK, we could go on a [k]city break[/k]. I love cities that have lots of [k]galleries[/k] and [k]museums[/k] to visit.
That's a great idea. Maybe we can find a place where there are some nice walks we can go on.
Yes, or maybe a [k]national park[/k] or big [k]castles[/k] in the countryside.
It all sounds really great. But where can we find all these things?
Hmm, I'm not sure. Maybe we should go to a travel agent and ask for some advice.
I'm free at the weekend, let's go on Saturday morning and get it booked.
James
Anna
Grammar: Passives
The sentence doesn't tell us who performed the action.
The festival was started in the early 1990s.
True or false?
The manager decided to close the restaurant.
The concert has been cancelled due to illness.
We can use the Passive Voice to focus the sentence on the action, rather than who carried it out, the 'doer'. We often use the passive voice when the doer is unknown, vague or obvious.

The concert has been cancelled due to illness.
The festival was started in the early 1990s.
The sentence tells us who performed the action.
The centre was opened by the Queen.
The house was severely damaged.
The house was broken into by two unarmed men.
The Passive Voice is often used to avoid saying who carried out the action. But if we want to include that information we can use by... after the passive sentence:
The window was broken by a falling tree.
Select the correct word(s) to fill the gap.
Active
Passive
I cook dinner...
[k]Dinner is cooked...[/k]
[k]Dinner is cooking...[/k]
[k]Dinner is cook...[/k]
I am cooking dinner...
[k]Dinner is being cooked...[/k]
[k]Dinner is being cook...[/k]
I will cook dinner...
[k]Dinner will be cooked...[/k]
[k]Dinner is to cook...[/k]
[k]Dinner will cooked...[/k]
I cooked dinner...
[k]Dinner was cooked...[/k]
[k]Dinner cooked...[/k]
[k]Dinner was cook...[/k]
I have cooked dinner...
[k]Dinner has been cooked...[/k]
[k]Dinner has be cooked...[/k]
[k]Dinner has been cook...[/k]

Passive sentences are formed with be + Past Participle. The tense is shown by the form of be. Past tense Passive uses 'be' in the past form (was/were), future passive uses 'be' in the future form (will be), etc.
Dinner was being served as we walked in. The centre will be opened on Saturday.
[k]This traditional dish[/k] [k]is[/k] [k]prepared[/k] [k]using[/k] [k]local ingredients.[/k]
[k]The school[/k] [k]was[/k] [k]built[/k] [k]by[/k] [k]the local community.[/k]
[k]Some minority languages[/k] [k]are[/k] [k]being[/k] [k]spoken[/k] [k]less and less.[/k]
[k]The community centre[/k] [k]has[/k] [k]been[/k] [k]broken into.[/k]
[k]The couple[/k] [k]will[/k] [k]be[/k] [k]married[/k] [k]on 21st July.[/k]
With the Passive Voice, the action is done to the subject of the sentence. This is the opposite to active sentences, where the subject performs the action:

Active: Someone stole the car. 
Passive: The car was stolen.
The eggs are then [k]mixed[/k] into the flour.
mix
The cakes [k]have been decorated[/k] by a professional.
decorated
The musician [k]earned[/k] a lot of money last year.
was earned
The show is watched [k]by[/k] 1 million people each week.
for
The gas [k]will be disconected[/k] if we don't pay the bill.
will disconnect
Active: They delivered us the packages yesterday.
Passive: The [k]packages were delivered[/k] yesterday.
Fill in the gap using the hint.
Active: Someone will fix the window before 7pm.
Passive: The [k]window will be fixed[/k] before 7pm.
Active: The police have found the missing man.
Passive: The [k]missing man has been found[/k] by the police.
Active: They are fixing the sink now.
Passive: The [k]sink is being fixed[/k] now.
